definitions: A small, often microscopic, tissue element in the form of a beam, strut, or rod that supports or anchors a framework of parts within a body or organ.
One of the fibrous bands extending from the capsule into the interior of an organ, such as the spleen or a lymph node.
A small bar or band of fibrous tissue, especially one of the supporting bundles of fibers in the connective tissue framework of a bodily organ.
examples: Trabeculae are visible under the microscope.
